Reviews.Title: Awesome buy!!
Reviews.Author: cancerbaby
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop two days ago at Staples after returning another brand that I probably shouldn't have bought in the first place. I've always choose to buy HP because I'm comfortable with the functionality of the brand. This however is a step up from my 15.4" that I use on occasion. There's lots to love about this machine like the price for starters and the keyboard is very nicely designed and user friendly if you're not accustom to braille keys.Obviously no machine is perfectly made, so here's a few of my pros and cons about the G7.Pros: Beautiful 17.3" screen, the color literally jumps off the screen which makes watching movies and videos a blast.Cons: If you're use to having the option of managing your touch pad from the keyboard section, be advised that this model doesn't have that option. The only way to do so would be through Device Manager. And oh there's a little circle thing on the touch pad, if you press it the touch pad is disabled but very pointless since you can't hold it and type.Pros: I like to listen to music while working out, so it was very important to have something that didn't muffle when turned up to a high decibel which this machine definitely doesn't do. It's clear and clean and very easy to hear.Overall as I said before this is a wonderful machine and a great buy. Couldn't ask for anything better for the price. Recommend to all those that are in the market for a great item.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Brandon L. Burton
Reviews.Content: After owning this laptop for a couple of months now, I feel safe in saying that this is an excellent computer that I am glad that I have.  The price of this computer is another key aspect that makes this computer such an excellent deal.  I have long been a user of HP computers; therefore, I think that I'm fairly qualified to attest to their reliability.  If they were not reliable, I would not continue to purchase them.Now to the HP g7 specifically.  One of the first things to catch my eye, besides the price, was the Intel Core i3 CPU.  I had always owned HP's with AMD processors as they seemed to be a little more affordable; however, this laptop had the same affordable price with an Intel processor.  This interested me greatly as I had always heard of Intel's great reputation for their fine processors.  Plus this processor is rated at around 2.5 GHz while most of my AMD's on laptops had been just below 2.0 GHz.  So, I admit that I had phenomenal expectations for the speed and power of this computer.  I'm sad to report that those expectations were not met by the Intel Core i3.  This is only one of the negatives that I must state.  To be fair though, it was a matter of expectations and not actual performance.  The Intel processor does a fine job of handling any tasks that I throw it's way, I guess I was expecting a little more from Intel based on their reputation.  So it is now my experience that the AMD processors are extremely comparable to the Intel processors in the HP's that I have owned.  I guess that I should have known that since I have always had really good performance from my AMD processors.  I say all of this to give an open and honest view of my experience with this computer.  I say all of this not too necessarily sway anyone away from this laptop, but I say this in case others have heard of the Intel reputation over AMD's.  Regarding this matter, I will restate that this processor has taken everything that I have thrown at it.  An example of this is that I have on more than one occasion had image manipulation programs open along with Firefox 4.0 with about a dozen tabs open with graphic websites with Windows file handling programs open along with other media (iTunes) playing all at the same time.  The Intel processor and 4 GBs of RAM handled all of this just fine.Speaking of some of these other specs, the 4GBs of RAM is nice at this price range in my opinion.  I also like the 500GBs Hard Drive.  That is plenty of room even for someone like me who downloads lots of Amazon mp3s and takes and stores lots of pictures.  I have found the Bluetooth feature to be useful with my smartphone.  It is also my opinion that the screen really pops.  It is a good size screen for a laptop with really good color in my opinion. Also in my opinion, the specs and feature set are really nice for this price range.If you have not had Windows 7 yet, I have found it to be stable.  Admittedly, I don't see too much difference from Vista.  I am glad to have the latest version of Windows for all of the latest drivers and such.  Just an FYI, Windows 7 is now up to SP 1.  I'm not sure if that will be pre-installed on the computer or if you will have to download it.  The laptop does have the Home Premium version of Windows 7.  I consider this a must as the Home Premium comes ready for networking and much media usage in addition to the standards of Windows.Lastly, this has been a solid performer for me in the couple of months that I have owned it.  I have been really pleased with the price point.  Since this laptop can be found at different price ranges, I'd like to share the price range I'm talking about.  When I purchased my laptop from a retail outlet on sale, it was $550 and $600 after taxes.  So basically I am talking about this laptop being in a nice price range around $600 and under as it is currently advertised with Amazon.  In summary, I really like this laptop with the only disappointment being that the Intel did not live up to all the hype as I expected it to be incredibly better than the AMD's.  Be that as it may, this laptop with the Intel processor performs just as well as other AMD's that I've owned.  With all of that said, I find this laptop to be an excellent computer for the price range.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: Bowldawg
Reviews.Content: I had a Dell Latitude D610 from college that just died a couple of months ago after 6 years. I spent two weeks researching different laptops and eventually settled for the HP G72-B66US 17.3" Laptop until I went to a local store and found out the last one was sold! The sales rep suggested this 2011 model, which has very similar specs and replaces the 2010 HP G72-B66US 17.3" Laptop. I was skeptical about making the purchase, especially since this was not part of my research.However, not only was it cheaper than the previous model, but it's also a huge improvement from the 2010 model. How so? The touch pad is not hard to use: the clicks are easy to push down, scrolling is easy with two fingers, and you can zoom in or out. I had always used a mouse b/c I'm not a huge touchpad fan, but this touchpad is great.  The exterior has a nice glossy finish vs. the 2010 model which looked like a cheap plastic exterior. Everything else seems to be just like the way the 2010 model is described.The only con is a relatively short battery life (2.5-3 hours), but compared to my old laptop where the battery lasted under an hour this is great!  The fan is on the side of the computer, so you don't have to worry about your lap burning or that you'll get cancer down there (lol).  This laptop is quiet and starts up easily and quickly.Considering how big this laptop is, 6 pounds feels like nothing. It's lighter than smaller models that are a few years older.  Speakers are average in quality, but can be turned up loud! And for laptops speakers, they are pretty good.  Overall, I'm very happy with this model and would recommend it to someone who likes movies, youtube, sports, photography, some gaming, music, recording software, business organization, etc.Feel free to ask questions and I'll do my best to answer them.

Reviews.Title: F9 allows boot from CD
Reviews.Author: Erol Esen
Reviews.Content: This is a good, solid machine.The title of this review is also the reason why I took a star off, because F9 hasn't been the norm for BIOS settings to change the order of boot devices. A little label on the keyboard would be helpful. I just went through all the function keys to find this out (not even Google was helpful!--But now it will be :).When the machine starts, press F9 and you can choose to boot from a CD if you like.This machine doesn't come with much clutter, unless you think MS Office is one.Initial battery life never impresses me, let's see how well it will stick to its multiple-hour promise a year from today. Battery is a problem for all computers. We need more technological advancement in this area.Price is great for the performance. I don't think you can go wrong with this purchase.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: This is one of the best sub $1,000 laptops. And I buy many of them
Reviews.Author: Macauley86
Reviews.Content: I purchase computers for my company. I've purchased several laptops under $1,000, from Lenovo to Toshiba, from Sony to HPs and Dells. This is one of the best. Nice, sturdy keyboard (for its price range), decently quiet, good feel, snappy, overall a pleasure to use. Sure it's not a high-end Lenovo T series, or an Appple Macbook Pro, but it's well worth its price. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop until now
Reviews.Author: Juan Jara V "coco"
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop a month ago and until now everything ok except for small things.I had a minor issue with the HDMI output, but solved online with HP support. On power saver mode the baterry will last about 3.5 hours, could be better. Great value for the money.I will update any inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: S. Carroll
Reviews.Content: Love my laptop. Have a desktop at home but bought this for traveling. Now this is all I use. Huge screen. My kids love to play games and watch videos on this. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Michelle M. Wilson "twbigdogsgirl"
Reviews.Content: I bought my laptop earlier this year with my taxes.  It has been a great machine.  No problems whatsoever.  I have used it to take an online class with video and it worked perfectly.  I am online all the time and never have a bit of trouble out of it.  I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Got this laptop back in may of 2011. It has amazing graphics. It plays the Sims 3 with no problems at all. The only problem I have with it is how hot it gets and the fan seems to not do much. Overall, it's great for 1080p video and extreme editing software like photoshop. Not a fan of HP at all, but this laptop is great.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Draper
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop - well, after I uninstalled all of the bloat-ware installed by HP (but that is the case with any laptop purchased from any vendor these days). It doesn't overheat like others I've had in the past. If you travel a lot, this may not be for you because of the size. I've found that the battery lasts for a few hours if the power settings are set correctly (brightness, fan speed, etc - all configurable in the control panel).

Reviews.Title: Very good, fast and big laptop!
Reviews.Author: Liverca Gomez
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy another laptop because mine got so hot that i couldn't type anything..yes and hp entertement dv2500, so i decided to begin the search for my next laptop. This one had all the specifications that i was looking for and the price was ok but i was a little afraid because all the reviews on it were like 50/50. After a few weeks with it i am pleased with my purchase because it does not get hot at all, it is very fast (4GB Ram Memory and Inter core 3i), enough space to save my documents (500GB hard Drive),a big big screen and not too heavy....just what i was looking for. Be aware it's not that portable ... 17.3" right!!?? I must say the laptop makes a weird sound and i think is the cooler...for me is ok but however this is why i give it 4 starts..im not bother by it but for those how are very easyly distrated could be something very annoyedUntil now i am very pleased with it...hope to keep that way!!!...and one more thing with the mousepad...is very easy to turn it off ..just double click in the left corner of it and done!...i don't have to turn it off to work but im just saying because one of the review was complaining about it.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it--think I got a lemon
Reviews.Author: Megan Heavens "slyminx"
Reviews.Content: I checked multiple websites for reviews on this laptop and the reviews were excellent.  When I got it, it worked great for about 1 week.  The picture and color are beautiful and it was fast, allowing me to do multiple tasks with ease.However, the fan started making a whirring sound like it was struggling, and the 10-key part of the keyboard was higher than the rest of the keys and had a hollow soud when you tapped them.  What made me decide to return it was within a week of receiving it, it started making that clicking sound you normally hear when you load a new web page, but it was making it every 60 seconds even when I wasn't on the internet.  I even turned the sound off and stayed on the desktop screen, letting the laptop do nothing, and it still made that loading sound every minute.  But to amazon's credit, they took it back no questions asked.  Purchased the newest version of the g7 instead.  Based on the other reviews I've seen, this laptop usually works fine, I think I just got a lemon.Update 7/20/11 Returned laptop and received full purchase price from seller.  Purchased a HP g7-1150 from amazon.  Works great!

Reviews.Title: Hard Drive Failed and had to be replaced
Reviews.Author: Mark Merritt
Reviews.Content: Don't recommend this. We bought this and within just a few weeks the hard drive failed. The place we took it said it is a recurring problem with this model computer.

Reviews.Title: Mine came with 3 defective keys on the keyboard
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Pfund
Reviews.Content: Mine came with 3 defective keys on the keyboard and I had to send it back.  I'm sure that this can happen with any laptop, and don't know if this is more prevalent with HPs. In any event, this particular laptop was a dud.

Reviews.Title: An Author's Best Friend
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Steele
Reviews.Content: I love my laptop and I really have only had one negative issue with it: the fan.I had my computer tech guy look into the reviews of it and the fan chips have been an issue.After sending it in to have the chip replaced: I have not had anymore issues.I think that it has made me a tad gun shy about purchasing another HP when I up-grade.Really I cannot complain; because I have had it for a year and that has been the only issue.In all fairness to HP, I am on my computer 8-12 hours a day writing and the fan has been the only issue.

Reviews.Title: Happy customer
Reviews.Author: RODOLFO DELGADO
Reviews.Content: First time buying this type of item over the Internet I do have so say it was a great experienceThe item was everything the description said if wasThank you

Reviews.Title: enjoying my new computer
Reviews.Author: Edith Villar
Reviews.Content: The laptop arrived on time just as promised!I will definately use this company again and I am enjoying my brand new laptop

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: CD3 "CD3"
Reviews.Content: Love my laptop...it's replacing another HP 17in laptop that died after 5 years...glad to have Win 7 and N wireless card. Laptop was received in original unopened box with all materials. It arrived within the estimate. I'm using the laptop right now. Getting used to Win 7 framework from XP's layout. No big deal. Machine is 50% cheaper than my previous model...this one has a webcam, more ram, more disk, and better processor. Great upgrade for a great price! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: I like the screen of this hp laptop. It a runs pretty quietly for a 17in. The only disappointment is the battery life, it last less than 3 hours with a low setting.

Reviews.Title: Been using this now for 2 months
Reviews.Author: Reluctant Badger
Reviews.Content: I would have given it a 4 except for the touch pad.Pro -* The screen is nice. (I came from a different computer that had same size, so for me it's similar but color seems a bit better.)* The keyboard, like all the HP keyboards has a good feel.* Not heavy at all. Much less to lug around.* Unlike some laptops, the WiFi seems pretty sensitive. My previous laptop had very good reception at quite a distance. This one isn't as good, but it's better than many.* Doesn't seem to need a fan good enough to make it fly in the Reno Air races. Quiet, haven't had overheating problems. A previous high-end HP laptop did.Con -* After 2 months, the I on the "I" key is worn off and there is a shiny spot on the space bar.* The touch pad isn't centered on the normal typing position like most laptops. This is quite irritating, because it means that the double-tap dip spot on the upper left is needed. What happens a lot when writing is I forget to tap it and I'll be typing away and suddenly find the cursor has landed 5 lines up and I've typed into the middle of a word in a sentence and have to fix it. Quite a PITA. There is no reason for the touch pad to be that wide or weirdly off-center of normal typing keys.* For some weird reason, the touch pad is not always the same if I tap it. Sometimes a light tap will do it. Sometimes no matter how hard I tap it never acts as a click. Minor irritation.* I have decided I really don't Windows 7. In fact, I silike it so much, I am seriously thinking about switching to a different OS. For instance, what idiot decided to eliminate the search function in Windows Explorer? Yeah "something" is in that little search box, but it's not as clear.* Not as fast as I expected from a new, "mo bettah" computer. This may be Windows 7, but it seems like every computer I get that runs faster on the clock rate gets things done slower.* I can't get a keyboard skin! I need to use one of those silicon molded things that fits the keys. They work great for preserving the keyboard and I can't find one.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i3 Processor 2.53GHz
4GB DDR3 RAM
500GB 5400RPM Hard Drive
17.3-Inch Screen, GMA
Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium, 5 hours Battery Life
ProductInfo.Name: HP g7-1070us Notebook PC - Silver
